intro: Randia albituba, commonly known as whitestem randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with smooth, often hairy stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually white or pale in color. Randia albituba is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments, making it a common sight in humid tropical forests.
